text: date: wed 12/08/1999 7:46 am from: richard von keyserling (rich@tennis.com)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: downloadable musicmr. silver is prepping the public to be handed another great lie by the recording industry. downloadable music will not be more expensive in real terms than distributing music through other media! ("digital music will cost you," 8.dec.1999). the recording industry is a massive oligopoly, wielding a lot of power by controlling the largest entertainment market in the world. they have the power to uniformly raise the price of music through artificial means. and that it is what we will see when they bring their shop to the internet.mr. silver's absurd notion that distributing music over the internet will cause reintermediation (more middle men) is just that: absurd. he seems adept at addition:"the net actually causes reintermediation" -
